meanings.definition: To hesitate or be unwilling to proceed.
meanings.sent1: She always bauks before making a decision.
meanings.sent2: The child bauks at the thought of going to the dentist.
meanings.sent3: The puppy bauks playfully before jumping into the water.
meanings.sent4: His fear of heights makes him bauks at climbing the ladder.
meanings.sent5: The student bauks at answering the difficult question in class.

meanings.definition: A ridge or raised area on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The hikers followed the bauks of the mountain trail.
meanings.sent2: The artist added bauks of paint to create texture in the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The cat enjoys scratching its claws on the bauks of the scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The old tree had deep bauks running along its trunk.
meanings.sent5: The farmer plowed the field, leaving bauks of soil behind.

meanings.definition: A large beam or timber used in construction.
meanings.sent1: The carpenters lifted the heavy bauks to build the house.
meanings.sent2: The ancient castle was supported by sturdy bauks of wood.
meanings.sent3: The beavers used bauks from fallen trees to construct their dam.
meanings.sent4: The bridge was reinforced with iron bauks for added strength.
meanings.sent5: The construction workers carefully measured the bauks before cutting them for the project.
